game_plan.overview: "Brick Buster" is a classic brick breaker arcade game where players control a paddle to bounce a ball upwards, breaking bricks arranged in patterns at the top of the screen, while aiming to clear all bricks without letting the ball fall below the paddle.
game_plan.mechanics: The game features a paddle, a ball, and bricks. The player moves the paddle left and right to catch the ball, with the goal of breaking all bricks by bouncing the ball off the paddle.

file.name: main.py
file.description: The entry point of the game that initializes Pygame and manages the main game loop. It handles quitting and starts the game instance.

file.name: game.py
file.description: Manages the overall game state, including initialization of game objects, updates per frame, and the transitions between different game states.

file.name: paddle.py
file.description: Represents the paddle controlled by the player, including methods to draw the paddle and update its position based on player input.

file.name: ball.py
file.description: Represents the ball that moves and interacts with the paddle and bricks. It includes methods for drawing the ball and updating its position while handling collisions.

file.name: brick.py
file.description: Defines individual bricks within the game, including their rendering and methods to check for collisions with the ball.

file.name: utils.py
file.description: Contains various utility functions such as collision detection and text rendering, which support the main game functionality.
